<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The rental car company Hertz gained 115% yesterday, erasing all its losses since it filed for bankruptcy just a few weeks ago.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Chesapeake Energy, which lost more than $8 billion in the first quarter, shot up more than 181%. Its stock price has jumped more than 700% since mid-May.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Meanwhile, Apple is back at a record high and worth $1.4 trillion.</span></li>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/08/work-home-becomes-work-anywhere?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Work From Home Becomes Work From Anywhere
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Office on wheels" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjU0L29mZmljZV9vbl93aGVlbHMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In what is believed to be a Morning Brew first, we're going to lead today's newsletter with an <a href="https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/thor-reports-a-profit-and-positive-net-cash-from-operations-for-the-third-quarter-of-fiscal-2020-301071551.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">earnings report</a> by an RV company—Thor Industries, to be specific, which makes Airstream and other brands. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tl;dr: It's a grand time to be an RV company. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Despite this being one of the most unusual quarters I have ever experienced," CEO Bob Martin said, "I am pleased to report that we were profitable and generated positive net cash from operations." </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"One new trend we are seeing is an evolution from 'work at home' to 'work from anywhere' as RV buyers use their new RVs as their office wherever they are, or wherever they want to be." </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Thanks for the transition, Bob</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Many white collar workers, freed from the confines of their office, are realizing they don't actually have to work from their literal home, either. And their wanderlust is giving a boost not only to RV companies, but to vacation rental platforms that were decimated by lockdowns.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Take Airbnb</strong>, which <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/05/tech/airbnb-layoffs/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cut 25%</a> of its workforce last month. Now, it says <em>more</em> U.S. listings were booked between May 17 and June 3 this year than the same period in 2019. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Work from home is becoming work from any home," CEO Brian Chesky </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-07/airbnb-joins-vacation-rental-sites-seeing-surge-in-summer-demand?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told Bloomberg</a></span><span>, adding that Airbnb has more listings now than before the pandemic.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The surprising rebound in demand means Airbnb is not ruling out an IPO this year—something that seemed inconceivable in April. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What do companies think? </strong>There doesn't seem to be a true consensus yet. Some Silicon Valley heavyweights like Twitter have <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/silicon-valleys-next-big-office-idea-work-from-anywhere-11589740234?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">embraced</a> the "work from anywhere" approach. Others, like Cisco, are slowly bringing employees back to the office, albeit with <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/07/business/coronavirus-offices-cdc-guidelines.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">elaborate tech</a> to keep them safe.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Embrace debate: </strong>Portfolio manager and Bloomberg Opinion columnist Conor Sen <a href="https://twitter.com/conorsen/status/1269952385390194693?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a> RVs are the "new commercial real estate." <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/08/poll-rv?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Do you agree</a>?</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/08/us-recession-began-february-according-nber?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
All Streaks Must Come to an End
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like saying "Chick-fil-A sauce is overrated," a committee at the National Bureau of Economic Research decided to state the obvious yesterday. After a record 128 months of expansion, the economy officially <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/06/08/872336272/its-official-scorekeepers-say-u-s-economy-is-in-a-recession?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">entered a recession</a> in February.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>How obvious was it? The NBER usually takes over a year to look at economic data before declaring a recession. This time, it...did not take that long.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The NBER's working definition of a recession is a "decline in economic activity that lasts more than a few months." </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Economists from other agencies decided to join in and rip off the Band-Aids in one sitting yesterday.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A survey of business economists predicted that U.S. GDP will </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/843b29f743bbd8a0ce8d45a027c49eba?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decline</a></span><span> 5.9% in 2020—the biggest drop since 1946.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The World Bank </span><span><a href="https://www.worldbank.org/en/news/press-release/2020/06/08/covid-19-to-plunge-global-economy-into-worst-recession-since-world-war-ii?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">predicted</a></span><span> a 5.2% contraction in the global economy this year and a 7% decline in advanced economies. The report also said emerging market economies would shrink as a group for the first time in 60 years. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>the technical recession could be relatively short as states lift pandemic restrictions and resume activity. However, a full recovery (especially in the jobs market) will take longer.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
IPO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/08/softbankbacked-insurance-startup-lemonade-tries-keep-ipo-market-sizzling?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Is That a Pan of Chili's Signature Sizzling Fajitas?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Fajitas" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/nqtA5obHo3CSelfeKS/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Fajitas" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/nqtA5obHo3CSelfeKS/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nope, it's just the U.S. IPO market. Yesterday, SoftBank-backed "insurtech" startup Lemonade <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/lemonade-insurance-startup-files-ipo-paperwork-to-go-public-2020-6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed to go public</a>. The $2 billion millennial-focused company, which sells renters and homeowners insurance, hopes to keep the IPO ball rolling after the busiest week for U.S. public offerings since the Before Times (February). </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Let's talk about those new faces </h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">ZoomInfo </strong></span><span>cashed in on some naming juju. Shares of the business-intelligence platform have more than doubled since its IPO last week, turning </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-08/zoominfo-duo-become-billionaires-with-stock-doubling-since-ipo?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">both founders into billionaires</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Nikola Corp. </strong></span><span>makes hydrogen- and battery-powered trucks that don't look like they belong in a cyberpunk dreamscape. After shares </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-08/nikola-rallies-71-to-record-ahead-of-zero-emission-truck-launch?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gained 104%</a></span><span> on its third day trading on the Nasdaq, the company is now worth $26 billion—and Elon is definitely looking in his rearview mirror. (Maybe they should just merge to form Nikola Tesla?)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Warner Music Group </strong></span><span>also had a </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/warner-music-sings-the-right-streaming-tune-11591268655?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">successful</a></span><span>, if less eye-popping, IPO last week.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>After disappointing IPOs from Uber and Lyft last year, it looked like investors had finally <a href="https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/ipo-market-outlook-trends-why-investors-rebelling-against-unicorns-implications-2019-9-1028570687?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">soured</a> on money-burning startups. But, even during a global pandemic, they’re back again. Except for Warner, all the companies listed above are unprofitable.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ More about Lemonade:</strong> Last year we invited CEO Daniel Schreiber on an episode of our podcast <em>Business Casual</em>. <a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/how-tech-is-making-insurance-sexy/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Give it a listen</a>. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTHCARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/08/report-big-hospitals-took-billions-grants-still-laid-off-workers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hospitals Get Their Own Checkup
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="healthcare" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjYxL2hvc3BpdGFsLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><em><a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/20563604.0/aHR0cHM6Ly9jb21tb25zLndpa2ltZWRpYS5vcmcvd2lraS9Vc2VyOkNsb3ZlcmNyZWF0aXZlZ3JvdXA/5d266fcb52f90804d40a2719Bf75434aa" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Clovercreativegroup</a>, <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/20563604.0/aHR0cHM6Ly9jb21tb25zLndpa2ltZWRpYS5vcmcvd2lraS9GaWxlOkVsbGlvdC1Ib3NwaXRhbC1NYW5jaGVzdGVyLU5ILmpwZw/5d266fcb52f90804d40a2719B701ed089" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Elliot-Hospital-Manchester-NH</a>, <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/20563604.0/aHR0cHM6Ly9jcmVhdGl2ZWNvbW1vbnMub3JnL2xpY2Vuc2VzL2J5LXNhLzQuMC9sZWdhbGNvZGU/5d266fcb52f90804d40a2719B8022baf8" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-SA 4.0</a></em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hospitals and money—two words that rarely combine in a feel-good story. Now mix in some pandemic relief funds...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In March, Congress approved a $175 billion package for hospitals to cover costs and lost revenue tied to treating COVID-19 patients. According to a NYT analysis, 60 of the largest U.S. hospital chains <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/08/business/hospitals-bailouts-ceo-pay.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collected</a> $15 billion.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Where it gets controversial</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At least 36 chains laid off, furloughed, or reduced pay of employees. And grant recipients included nonprofits and publicly traded firms (like HCA and Tenet Healthcare) with tens of billions in emergency cash reserves.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A Kaiser Family Foundation study suggests formulas used to calculate grants were based on patient revenue (benefitting hospitals serving wealthier, privately insured patients) and didn't take into account financial need.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Department of Health and Human Services says it had to get money out fast, and accounting for need would've slowed things down. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Hospitals didn't have to apply for grants, though it was encouraged they use them to pay and protect doctors, nurses, and other workers. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Many big hospital chains <em>are</em> taking a hit. But their rainy day funds can <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/amid-coronavirus-distress-wealthy-hospitals-hoard-millions/2020/04/27/9c84ccc0-866b-11ea-878a-86477a724bdb_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">survive</a> a hurricane, whereas most smaller and rural hospitals only have 30 days of runway.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/08/map-apps-use-quick-updates-capture-actions-protesters?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Protesters Find Allies in Map Apps
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="black lives matter plaza" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjU3L2JsYWNrX2xpdmVzX21hdHRlcl9wbGF6YS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Apple Maps</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There's no better feeling than shaving a few minutes off the Google Maps ETA. But less competitive users have spotted some map updates relevant to the ongoing protests over racial injustice.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Apple Maps </strong></span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/8/21283744/black-lives-matter-satelliite-apple-maps?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quickly patched</a></span><span> the satellite view of Washington, D.C. to show the Black Lives Matter mural commissioned last Friday by Mayor Muriel Bowser. You can see it in the screenshot above. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Google Maps </strong></span><span>also relabeled</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> </strong></span><span>the portion of 16th St. covered by the mural as “Black Lives Matter Plaza” to reflect Mayor Bowser’s </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/live-updates-protests-for-racial-justice/2020/06/05/870833518/black-lives-matter-plaza-across-from-white-house-is-christened-by-d-c-leaders?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">official renaming</a></span><span>. It updated the software in a matter of hours. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even Snap Map, the under-the-radar Snapchat feature, has proven to be a <a href="https://www.imore.com/how-use-snapchat-see-heat-maps-where-protests-are-happening?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">valuable tool</a> for protesters. "Heat maps" show large congregations of Snap users, while Snap stories give real-time, on-the-ground updates. Snap Map was also used to <a href="https://www.axios.com/school-walkouts-snapchat-visualization-parkland-gun-7cd34b9f-9c27-4e68-bc05-65835ff92631.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">visualize</a> the school walkouts protesting gun violence in 2018. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here:</strong> Google Maps is rolling out <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/8/21284027/google-maps-covid-19-coronavirus-driving-transit-alerts?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">COVID-19 alerts</a>, including reminders to wear face masks on public transportation, to help people navigate cities emerging from pandemic restrictions. </p>

KIWI TRIVIA
</h3>
</td>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWork From Home Becomes Work From Anywhere\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Office on wheels\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjU0L29mZmljZV9vbl93aGVlbHMuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn what is believed to be a Morning Brew first, we're going to lead today's newsletter with an \u003ca href=\"https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/thor-reports-a-profit-and-positive-net-cash-from-operations-for-the-third-quarter-of-fiscal-2020-301071551.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eearnings report\u003c/a\u003e by an RV company—Thor Industries, to be specific, which makes Airstream and other brands. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTl;dr: It's a grand time to be an RV company. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"Despite this being one of the most unusual quarters I have ever experienced,\" CEO Bob Martin said, \"I am pleased to report that we were profitable and generated positive net cash from operations.\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"One new trend we are seeing is an evolution from 'work at home' to 'work from anywhere' as RV buyers use their new RVs as their office wherever they are, or wherever they want to be.\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThanks for the transition, Bob\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMany white collar workers, freed from the confines of their office, are realizing they don't actually have to work from their literal home, either. And their wanderlust is giving a boost not only to RV companies, but to vacation rental platforms that were decimated by lockdowns.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTake Airbnb\u003c/strong\u003e, which \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/05/tech/airbnb-layoffs/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecut 25%\u003c/a\u003e of its workforce last month. Now, it says \u003cem\u003emore\u003c/em\u003e U.S. listings were booked between May 17 and June 3 this year than the same period in 2019. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\"Work from home is becoming work from any home,\" CEO Brian Chesky \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-07/airbnb-joins-vacation-rental-sites-seeing-surge-in-summer-demand?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, adding that Airbnb has more listings now than before the pandemic.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe surprising rebound in demand means Airbnb is not ruling out an IPO this year—something that seemed inconceivable in April. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat do companies think? \u003c/strong\u003eThere doesn't seem to be a true consensus yet. Some Silicon Valley heavyweights like Twitter have \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/silicon-valleys-next-big-office-idea-work-from-anywhere-11589740234?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eembraced\u003c/a\u003e the \"work from anywhere\" approach. Others, like Cisco, are slowly bringing employees back to the office, albeit with \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/07/business/coronavirus-offices-cdc-guidelines.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eelaborate tech\u003c/a\u003e to keep them safe.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEmbrace debate: \u003c/strong\u003ePortfolio manager and Bloomberg Opinion columnist Conor Sen \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/conorsen/status/1269952385390194693?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites\u003c/a\u003e RVs are the \"new commercial real estate.\" \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/08/poll-rv?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nAll Streaks Must Come to an End\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike saying \"Chick-fil-A sauce is overrated,\" a committee at the National Bureau of Economic Research decided to state the obvious yesterday. After a record 128 months of expansion, the economy officially \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/06/08/872336272/its-official-scorekeepers-say-u-s-economy-is-in-a-recession?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eentered a recession\u003c/a\u003e in February.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHow obvious was it? The NBER usually takes over a year to look at economic data before declaring a recession. This time, it...did not take that long.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe NBER's working definition of a recession is a \"decline in economic activity that lasts more than a few months.\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eEconomists from other agencies decided to join in and rip off the Band-Aids in one sitting yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA survey of business economists predicted that U.S. GDP will \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/843b29f743bbd8a0ce8d45a027c49eba?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edecline\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e 5.9% in 2020—the biggest drop since 1946.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe World Bank \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.worldbank.org/en/news/press-release/2020/06/08/covid-19-to-plunge-global-economy-into-worst-recession-since-world-war-ii?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epredicted\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a 5.2% contraction in the global economy this year and a 7% decline in advanced economies. The report also said emerging market economies would shrink as a group for the first time in 60 years. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003ethe technical recession could be relatively short as states lift pandemic restrictions and resume activity. However, a full recovery (especially in the jobs market) will take longer.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNope, it's just the U.S. IPO market. Yesterday, SoftBank-backed \"insurtech\" startup Lemonade \u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/lemonade-insurance-startup-files-ipo-paperwork-to-go-public-2020-6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled to go public\u003c/a\u003e. The $2 billion millennial-focused company, which sells renters and homeowners insurance, hopes to keep the IPO ball rolling after the busiest week for U.S. public offerings since the Before Times (February). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLet's talk about those new faces \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoomInfo \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ecashed in on some naming juju. Shares of the business-intelligence platform have more than doubled since its IPO last week, turning \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-08/zoominfo-duo-become-billionaires-with-stock-doubling-since-ipo?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eboth founders into billionaires\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNikola Corp. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003emakes hydrogen- and battery-powered trucks that don't look like they belong in a cyberpunk dreamscape. After shares \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-08/nikola-rallies-71-to-record-ahead-of-zero-emission-truck-launch?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egained 104%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on its third day trading on the Nasdaq, the company is now worth $26 billion—and Elon is definitely looking in his rearview mirror. (Maybe they should just merge to form Nikola Tesla?)\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWarner Music Group \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ealso had a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/warner-music-sings-the-right-streaming-tune-11591268655?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuccessful\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, if less eye-popping, IPO last week.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter disappointing IPOs from Uber and Lyft last year, it looked like investors had finally \u003ca href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/ipo-market-outlook-trends-why-investors-rebelling-against-unicorns-implications-2019-9-1028570687?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esoured\u003c/a\u003e on money-burning startups. But, even during a global pandemic, they’re back again. Except for Warner, all the companies listed above are unprofitable.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHospitals and money—two words that rarely combine in a feel-good story. Now mix in some pandemic relief funds...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn March, Congress approved a $175 billion package for hospitals to cover costs and lost revenue tied to treating COVID-19 patients. According to a NYT analysis, 60 of the largest U.S. hospital chains \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/08/business/hospitals-bailouts-ceo-pay.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecollected\u003c/a\u003e $15 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhere it gets controversial\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt least 36 chains laid off, furloughed, or reduced pay of employees. And grant recipients included nonprofits and publicly traded firms (like HCA and Tenet Healthcare) with tens of billions in emergency cash reserves.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA Kaiser Family Foundation study suggests formulas used to calculate grants were based on patient revenue (benefitting hospitals serving wealthier, privately insured patients) and didn't take into account financial need.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Department of Health and Human Services says it had to get money out fast, and accounting for need would've slowed things down. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHospitals didn't have to apply for grants, though it was encouraged they use them to pay and protect doctors, nurses, and other workers. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eMany big hospital chains \u003cem\u003eare\u003c/em\u003e taking a hit. But their rainy day funds can \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/amid-coronavirus-distress-wealthy-hospitals-hoard-millions/2020/04/27/9c84ccc0-866b-11ea-878a-86477a724bdb_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurvive\u003c/a\u003e a hurricane, whereas most smaller and rural hospitals only have 30 days of runway.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere's no better feeling than shaving a few minutes off the Google Maps ETA. But less competitive users have spotted some map updates relevant to the ongoing protests over racial injustice.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eApple Maps \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/8/21283744/black-lives-matter-satelliite-apple-maps?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equickly patched\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the satellite view of Washington, D.C. to show the Black Lives Matter mural commissioned last Friday by Mayor Muriel Bowser. You can see it in the screenshot above. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGoogle Maps \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ealso relabeled\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ethe portion of 16th St. covered by the mural as “Black Lives Matter Plaza” to reflect Mayor Bowser’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/live-updates-protests-for-racial-justice/2020/06/05/870833518/black-lives-matter-plaza-across-from-white-house-is-christened-by-d-c-leaders?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eofficial renaming\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. It updated the software in a matter of hours. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEven Snap Map, the under-the-radar Snapchat feature, has proven to be a \u003ca href=\"https://www.imore.com/how-use-snapchat-see-heat-maps-where-protests-are-happening?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evaluable tool\u003c/a\u003e for protesters. \"Heat maps\" show large congregations of Snap users, while Snap stories give real-time, on-the-ground updates. Snap Map was also used to \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/school-walkouts-snapchat-visualization-parkland-gun-7cd34b9f-9c27-4e68-bc05-65835ff92631.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evisualize\u003c/a\u003e the school walkouts protesting gun violence in 2018. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here:\u003c/strong\u003e Google Maps is rolling out \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/8/21284027/google-maps-covid-19-coronavirus-driving-transit-alerts?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCOVID-19 alerts\u003c/a\u003e, including reminders to wear face masks on public transportation, to help people navigate
